annotate.annotation_filters.description: A comma separated list of filters to apply to putative annotations

annotate.draw_fusions_only.description: Flag to indicate if events which do not produce a fusion transcript should produce illustrations

annotate.draw_non_synonymous_cdna_only.description: Flag to indicate if events which are synonymous at the cdna level should produce illustrations

annotate.max_orf_cap.description: The maximum number of orfs to return (best putative orfs will be retained)

annotate.min_domain_mapping_match.description: A number between 0 and 1 representing the minimum percent match a domain must map to the fusion transcript to be displayed

annotate.min_orf_size.description: The minimum length (in base pairs) to retain a putative open reading frame (orf)

bam_stats.distribution_fraction.description: the proportion of the distribution to use in computing stdev

bam_stats.sample_bin_size.description: how large to make the sample bin (in bp)

bam_stats.sample_cap.description: maximum number of reads to collect for any given sample region

bam_stats.sample_size.description: the number of genes/bins to compute stats over

cluster.cluster_initial_size_limit.description: The maximum cumulative size of both breakpoints for breakpoint pairs to be used in the initial clustering phase (combining based on overlap)

cluster.cluster_radius.description: Maximum distance allowed between paired breakpoint pairs

cluster.limit_to_chr.description: A list of chromosome names to use. breakpointpairs on other chromosomes will be filteredout. for example '1 2 3 4' would filter out events/breakpoint pairs on any chromosomes but 1, 2, 3, and 4

cluster.max_files.description: The maximum number of files to output from clustering/splitting

cluster.max_proximity.description: The maximum distance away from an annotation before the region in considered to be uninformative

cluster.min_clusters_per_file.description: The minimum number of breakpoint pairs to output to a file

cluster.split_only.description: just split the input files, do not merge input breakpoints into clusters

cluster.uninformative_filter.description: Flag that determines if breakpoint pairs which are not within max_proximity to any annotations are filtered out prior to clustering

assume_no_untemplated.description: Assume the lack of untemplated information means that there IS not untemplated sequence expected at the breakpoints

file_type.description: the tool the file is input from or 'mavis' for standard mavis-style tab files

illustrate.domain_name_regex_filter.description: The regular expression used to select domains to be displayed (filtered by name)

illustrate.domain_scaffold_color.description: The color of the domain scaffold

illustrate.drawing_width_iter_increase.description: The amount (in  pixels) by which to increase the drawing width upon failure to fit

illustrate.exon_min_focus_size.description: Minimum size of an exon for it to be granted a label or min exon width

illustrate.gene1_color.description: The color of genes near the first gene

illustrate.gene1_color_selected.description: The color of the first gene

illustrate.gene2_color.description: The color of genes near the second gene

illustrate.gene2_color_selected.description: The color of the second gene

illustrate.mask_fill.description: Color of mask (for deleted region etc.)

illustrate.max_drawing_retries.description: The maximum number of retries for attempting a drawing. each iteration the width is extended. if it is still insufficient after this number a gene-level only drawing will be output

illustrate.scaffold_color.description: The color used for the gene/transcripts scaffolds

total_batches.description: The number of jobs to slit a library into for cluster/validate/annotate

strand_determining_read.description: 1 or 2. the read in the pair which determines if (assuming a stranded protocol) the first or second read in the pair matches the strand sequenced

pairing.contig_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by contig) in order for them to pair

pairing.flanking_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by flanking pairs) in order for them to pair

pairing.input_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by input tools, not validated) in order for them to pair

pairing.spanning_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by spanning reads) in order for them to pair

pairing.split_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by split reads) in order for them to pair

skip_stage.validate.description: skip the validation stage of the MAVIS pipeline

summary.filter_cdna_synon.description: Filter all annotations synonymous at the cdna level

summary.filter_min_complexity.description: Filter event calls based on call sequence complexity

summary.filter_min_flanking_reads.description: Minimum number of flanking pairs for a call by flanking pairs

summary.filter_min_linking_split_reads.description: Minimum number of linking split reads for a call by split reads

summary.filter_min_remapped_reads.description: Minimum number of remapped reads for a call by contig

summary.filter_min_spanning_reads.description: Minimum number of spanning reads for a call by spanning reads

summary.filter_min_split_reads.description: Minimum number of split reads for a call by split reads

summary.filter_protein_synon.description: Filter all annotations synonymous at the protein level

summary.filter_trans_homopolymers.description: Filter all single bp ins/del/dup events that are in a homopolymer region of at least 3 bps and are not paired to a genomic event

validate.aligner.description: The aligner to use to map the contigs/reads back to the reference e.g blat or bwa

validate.assembly_kmer_size.description: The percent of the read length to make kmers for assembly

validate.assembly_max_paths.description: The maximum number of paths to resolve. this is used to limit when there is a messy assembly graph to resolve. the assembly will pre-calculate the number of paths (or putative assemblies) and stop if it is greater than the given setting

validate.assembly_min_edge_trim_weight.description: This is used to simplify the debruijn graph before path finding. edges with less than this frequency will be discarded if they are non-cutting, at a fork, or the end of a path

validate.assembly_min_exact_match_to_rem.description: The minimum length of exact matches to initiate remapping a read to a contig

validate.assembly_min_remap_coverage.description: Minimum fraction of the contig sequence which the remapped sequences must align over

validate.assembly_min_remapped_seq.description: The minimum input sequences that must remap for an assembled contig to be used

validate.assembly_min_uniq.description: Minimum percent uniq required to keep separate assembled contigs. if contigs are more similar then the lower scoring, then shorter, contig is dropped

validate.assembly_strand_concordance.description: When the number of remapped reads from each strand are compared, the ratio must be above this number to decide on the strand

validate.blat_limit_top_aln.description: Number of results to return from blat (ranking based on score)

validate.blat_min_identity.description: The minimum percent identity match required for blat results when aligning contigs

validate.call_error.description: Buffer zone for the evidence window

validate.clean_aligner_files.description: Remove the aligner output files after the validation stage is complete. not required for subsequent steps but can be useful in debugging and deep investigation of events

validate.contig_aln_max_event_size.description: Relates to determining breakpoints when pairing contig alignments. for any given read in a putative pair the soft clipping is extended to include any events of greater than this size. the softclipping is added to the side of the alignment as indicated by the breakpoint we are assigning pairs to

validate.contig_aln_merge_inner_anchor.description: The minimum number of consecutive exact match base pairs to not merge events within a contig alignment

validate.contig_aln_merge_outer_anchor.description: Minimum consecutively aligned exact matches to anchor an end for merging internal events

validate.contig_aln_min_anchor_size.description: The minimum number of aligned bases for a contig (m or =) in order to simplify. do not have to be consecutive

validate.contig_aln_min_extend_overlap.description: Minimum number of bases the query coverage interval must be extended by in order to pair alignments as a single split alignment

validate.contig_aln_min_query_consumptio.description: Minimum fraction of the original query sequence that must be used by the read(s) of the alignment

validate.contig_aln_min_score.description: Minimum score for a contig to be used as evidence in a call by contig

validate.fetch_min_bin_size.description: The minimum size of any bin for reading from a bam file. increasing this number will result in smaller bins being merged or less bins being created (depending on the fetch method)

validate.fetch_reads_bins.description: Number of bins to split an evidence window into to ensure more even sampling of high coverage regions

validate.fetch_reads_limit.description: Maximum number of reads, cap, to loop over for any given evidence window

validate.filter_secondary_alignments.description: Filter secondary alignments when gathering read evidence

validate.fuzzy_mismatch_number.description: The number of events/mismatches allowed to be considered a fuzzy match

validate.max_sc_preceeding_anchor.description: When remapping a softclipped read this determines the amount of softclipping allowed on the side opposite of where we expect it. for example for a softclipped read on a breakpoint with a left orientation this limits the amount of softclipping that is allowed on the right. if this is set to none then there is no limit on softclipping

validate.min_anchor_exact.description: Applies to re-aligning softclipped reads to the opposing breakpoint. the minimum number of consecutive exact matches to anchor a read to initiate targeted realignment

validate.min_anchor_fuzzy.description: Applies to re-aligning softclipped reads to the opposing breakpoint. the minimum length of a fuzzy match to anchor a read to initiate targeted realignment

validate.min_anchor_match.description: Minimum percent match for a read to be kept as evidence

validate.min_call_complexity.description: The minimum complexity score for a call sequence. is an average for non-contig calls. filters low complexity contigs before alignment. see [contig_complexity](#contig_complexity)

validate.min_double_aligned_to_estimate_.description: The minimum number of reads which map soft-clipped to both breakpoints to assume the size of the untemplated sequence between the breakpoints is at most the read length - 2 * min_softclipping

validate.min_flanking_pairs_resolution.description: The minimum number of flanking reads required to call a breakpoint by flanking evidence

validate.min_linking_split_reads.description: The minimum number of split reads which aligned to both breakpoints

validate.min_mapping_quality.description: The minimum mapping quality of reads to be used as evidence

validate.min_non_target_aligned_split_re.description: The minimum number of split reads aligned to a breakpoint by the input bam and no forced by local alignment to the target region to call a breakpoint by split read evidence

validate.min_sample_size_to_apply_percen.description: Minimum number of aligned bases to compute a match percent. if there are less than this number of aligned bases (match or mismatch) the percent comparator is not used

validate.min_softclipping.description: Minimum number of soft-clipped bases required for a read to be used as soft-clipped evidence

validate.min_spanning_reads_resolution.description: Minimum number of spanning reads required to call an event by spanning evidence

validate.min_splits_reads_resolution.description: Minimum number of split reads required to call a breakpoint by split reads

validate.outer_window_min_event_size.description: The minimum size of an event in order for flanking read evidence to be collected

validate.stdev_count_abnormal.description: The number of standard deviations away from the normal considered expected and therefore not qualifying as flanking reads

validate.trans_fetch_reads_limit.description: Related to [fetch_reads_limit](#fetch_reads_limit). overrides fetch_reads_limit for transcriptome libraries when set. if this has a value of none then fetch_reads_limit will be used for transcriptome libraries instead

validate.trans_min_mapping_quality.description: Related to [min_mapping_quality](#min_mapping_quality). overrides the min_mapping_quality if the library is a transcriptome and this is set to any number not none. if this value is none, min_mapping_quality is used for transcriptomes aswell as genomes

validate.write_evidence_files.description: Write the intermediate bam and bed files containing the raw evidence collected and contigs aligned. not required for subsequent steps but can be useful in debugging and deep investigation of events
